keyword: how many calories is in a reeses cup
title: How Many Calories in a Reese's Cup?
meta_description: Discover how many calories is in a Reese's cup, plus full nutrition breakdown including carbs, fat, protein, and quick tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in a Reese's Cup?
assumptions: Standard milk chocolate Reese's Peanut Butter Cup (~21 g), single cup from a standard pack, no additional toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, size, flavor, and manufacturing; check packaging for exact values.

quick_answer.text: One standard Reese's Peanut Butter Cup has about 105 kcal and 2.5 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: King size Reese's cup (double standard size)

faqs.q: How many calories is in a Reese's cup?
faqs.a: A standard Reese's Peanut Butter Cup contains about 105 kcal.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in one Reese's cup?
faqs.a: Approximately 12 g of carbs, including 10 g sugars and 0.5 g fiber.

faqs.q: How much fat is in a Reese's cup?
faqs.a: About 6 g total fat, with 3 g saturated fat per cup.

faqs.q: Does a Reese's cup have protein?
faqs.a: Yes, around 2.5 g protein from the peanut butter.

faqs.q: How does Reese's cup size affect calories?
faqs.a: Mini cups are ~50 kcal, king size ~210 kcal; always check the label.
